discoveredAssets: localhost:32768 - Dalgona Challenges (Flask/Werkzeug 1.0.1 Python 2.7.18) - Port 32768 HTTP - Only root (/) accessible
localhost:32768/static/ - Static content delivery (CSS, images) - Directory listing disabled

targets.objective: Test root endpoint for injection vulnerabilities, CSRF, XSS in rendered content, authentication bypass, and information disclosure via error messages
targets.rationale: The only accessible endpoint that returns content. Should be tested for common web application vulnerabilities including input validation, output encoding, CSRF token presence, and HTTP security headers

targets.objective: Enumerate challenge endpoint variations, test for hidden/alternative paths, and attempt to trigger challenge content loading
targets.rationale: Challenge endpoint is referenced in homepage but returns 404. May be accessible via alternative paths, HTTP methods, or parameter manipulation. Could represent incomplete deployment or access control bypass opportunity

targets.objective: Test static file serving for path traversal vulnerabilities, archive extraction, backup file disclosure
targets.rationale: Static directory listing returns 404, but individual files are served. Test for path traversal (/static/../../etc/passwd), backup files (.bak, .old, .swp), and hidden configuration files

keyFindings: [MEDIUM] Minimal attack surface - only root endpoint functional (/) on Flask/Werkzeug application
[MEDIUM] Challenge endpoints referenced in UI but not implemented - /xss25 returns 404 across all path variations
[LOW] Static asset files accessible - individual files served correctly but directory listing disabled
[LOW] No API endpoints discovered - /api, /api/v1, /graphql all return 404
[LOW] No authentication mechanism visible - no login, auth, or SSO endpoints found
[LOW] No configuration exposure - .env, .git, config files not accessible
[INFO] Python 2.7.18 detected via Server header - EOL version (unsupported since 2020)
[INFO] Werkzeug 1.0.1 development server used - should not be used in production
